FuncDef:
The dhcpv6-server group command binds a DHCPv6 server group to an address pool.
The undo dhcpv6-server group command unbinds a DHCPv6 server group from an address pool.
By default, a DHCPv6 server group is not bound to any address pool.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of the DHCPv6 server group.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-insensitive characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If addresses or prefixes need to be allocated from a remote server, run the dhcpv6-server group command to bind an address pool on the remote server to a DHCPv6 server group.
Prerequisites
Before binding a DHCPv6 server group to an address pool, you need to run the dhcpv6-server group command in the system view to create the DHCPv6 server group.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
The dhcpv6-server group command can be used only in a remote address pool view.
